question: What was Aggo Dah Gauda punished with for using that foot against a venerable medicine man?
answer1: one leg looped up to his thigh, so that he was obliged to get along by hopping

question: Who had a beautiful daughter?
answer1: Aggo Dah Gauda

question: What did Aggo consider to be his chief care?
answer1: secure his daughter from being carried off by the king of the buffalos

question: Where did Aggo live?
answer1: in great state, having a log house of his own, and a court-yard which extended from the sill of his front-door as many hundred miles westward as he chose to measure it

question: What did Aggo advise his daughter to do?
answer1: keep within doors, and by no means to go far in the neighborhood

question: Why did Aggo tell his daughter to keep within doors?
answer1: She would otherwise be sure to be stolen away.
answer2: The buffalo-king spent night and day lurking about and lying in wait to seize her.

question: What did Aggo do before he left the lodge?
answer1: reminded his daughter of her strange and industrious lover

question: How did Aggo feel going fishing?
answer1: in high spirits

question: What was Aggo prepared to do?
answer1: go out a-fishing

question: Who did Aggo suspect was singing?
answer1: the king of the buffalos

question: What will the daughter do since she does not want to be kept in doors?
answer1: get on top of the house and comb and dress her hair

question: Why did the king of the buffalos place the daughter upon the back of one of his favorite buffalos?
answer1: to make sure of her by means of her drooping tresses

question: Where did the king of the buffalos plunge into that bounded his land?
answer1: a river

question: What did the daughter do at the lodge of the king of the buffalos?
answer1: sat pensive and disconsolate in the lodge, among the other females
answer2: scarcely ever spoke
answer3: did not take the least interest in the affairs of the king's household

question: How did the king of the buffalos try to win the daughter's affection?
answer1: labored with great zeal
answer2: breathed forth to her every soft and gentle word he could think of

question: What happened to the king after the daughter was not content with these proofs of attachment?
answer1: He fasted from all food, and having thus purified his spirit and cleared his voice.
answer2: He took his Indian flute and gave vent to his feelings in pensive echoes.

question: Why did the king go out hunting to obtain the most dainty meats, both of animals and wild fowl?
answer1: to pleasure Aggo's daughter's palate

question: Why did the king enjoin a special edict on the pain of instant death?
answer1: to give to Aggo's daughter every thing that she wanted
answer2: to be careful not to displease Aggo's daughter

question: What happened after Aggo discovered his daughter had been stolen?
answer1: Aggo's indignation was so thoroughly awakened that he would have forthwith torn every hair from his head.
answer2: Aggo hopped off half a mile in every direction.

question: What did Aggo vow?
answer1: His single leg should never know rest again until he had found his beautiful daughter and brought her home.

question: Why could Aggo not easily track the buffalo-king when he reached the banks of the river?
answer1: There having been a frosty night or two since, the water was so covered with thin ice that Aggo could not venture upon it.

question: What did Aggo do to cross over the lake?
answer1: encamped hard by till it became more solid

question: How did Aggo's daughter guide her father to find her?
answer1: She purposely had branches broken off and strewed behind.

question: What did Aggo's daughter use as signs to her father?
answer1: twigs

question: How did the daughter appear to the king when she saw her father?
answer1: She appeared to relent in her heart.

question: Who did the king espy by the light of the moon?
answer1: Aggo Dah Gauda with his daughter in his arms

question: What did the king order his herd to do?
answer1: take Aggo dead or alive

question: What did the king consider to be a mortal shame?
answer1: to be outstripped by a man with one leg tied up

question: What happened after Aggo kept the buffalos zig-zagging?
answer1: The buffalos were driven half out of their wits.
answer2: The buffalos roared, and brandished their tails, and foamed, as if they would put out of countenance and frighten out of sight the old man in the moon

question: Why did the king flee?
answer1: He lost at last all patience at the absurd idea of chasing a man with one leg all night long.

question: What happened to the king after he fled in disgust?
answer1: The king never more appeared in all that part of the country.

question: How did Aggo feel when the king fled?
answer1: relieved

question: Who did Aggo's daughter marry?
answer1: a very worthy young warrior

question: How was the young warrior different from the king of the buffalos?
answer1: The young warrior was not the owner of any more of the buffalos than a splendid skin robe which he wore.

question: Why did the king of the buffalos want to carry off with Aggo's daughter?
answer1: He wanted to marry her.
answer2: He wanted to make her his wife.

question: How will Aggo feel if his daughter is taken away by the king of the buffalos?
answer1: angry
answer2: heartbroken

question: Why did Aggo fear that the daughter would be taken away while he went fishing?
answer1: He would not be there to protect her.
answer2: She never saw her strange and industrious lover before.
answer3: He was going to be out of the lodge.

question: How will the daughter feel being kept in doors forever?
answer1: bored
answer2: lonely

question: Why was the daughter taken by the king of the buffalos?
answer1: He loved her.
answer2: She was wholly occupied in combing her hair.

question: How will the daughter feel being with the king of the buffalos?
answer1: unhappy
answer2: uncomfortable

question: Why did the king's subjects treat Aggo's daughter well?
answer1: They did not want the pain of instant death.
answer2: They did not want to displease her.
answer3: They had to follow the special edict.

question: How will the king feel when Aggo's daughter does not return his affections?
answer1: sad
answer2: heartbroken

question: Why did the daughter ask for the royal dipper?
answer1: to get the king a drink of water
answer2: to sneak away to her father

question: Why did the king wait with impatience for her return?
answer1: The daughter was willing to submit to him.
answer2: The daughter was getting him a drink.
answer3: The daughter was responding to his affections.

question: Why did the buffalos think they could overtake Aggo easily?
answer1: Aggo only had one leg.
answer2: Aggo was carrying his daughter.
answer3: The buffalos were plenty and powerful.

question: How did Aggo outsmart the buffalos?
answer1: Aggo would hop to be in contact with another herd.
answer2: Aggo kept the whole company of buffalos zig-zagging.
answer3: Aggo changed the direction of his hopping.

question: Why did Aggo hop about livelier than ever on his daughter's wedding-day?
answer1: His daughter was marrying a very worthy young warrior.
answer2: His daughter was not marrying the king of the buffalos.
answer3: The king of the buffalos was no longer pursuing his daughter.
